Sikh warriors were expected to uphold these values, using their martial skills to safeguard their community and promote righteousness. This ethical dimension of Sikh warriorship is rooted in the teachings of the Guru Granth Sahib, which emphasizes the need for spiritual warriors to embody compassion, humility, and self-discipline.

In summary, the principle of Miri-Piri in Sikhism informs the association between Sikhism and warriorship by emphasizing the interplay between spiritual sovereignty and temporal responsibility.
